OptionChoice.name: enableMekanism
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation handle Mekanism ore generation?

Choice.description: Use Custom Ore Generation to handle Mekanism ores.
Mekanism ores will be handled by the mod itself.

OptionChoice.name: cleanUpMekanism
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation use the Substitution Pass to remove all instances of Mekanism ore from the world? If the mod's oregen can be turned off in its configuration, then it's recommended to do so, as the substitution pass can slow the game significantly. If this option is disabled without disabling the mod's own ore generation, you'll end up with two oregens working at once, flooding the world with ore. Enabled by default to ensure the ores are completely removed.

Choice.description: Use the substitution pass to clean up Mekanism ores.
Mekanism ores do not need to be cleaned up by a substitution pass.

Choice.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

Choice.description: Osmium is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: mknsOsmiumFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Mekanism Osmium distributions

OptionNumeric.name: mknsOsmiumSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Mekanism Osmium distributions

OptionChoice.name: mknsMountainOsmiumDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Mountain Osmium is generated

Substitute.name: mknsOverworldBlockSubstitute0
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Veins.name: mknsOsmiumVeins
Veins.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

Cloud.name: mknsOsmiumCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi- permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.

Veins.name: mknsOsmiumHintVeins
Veins.Description: Single blocks, generously scattered through all heights (density is about that of vanilla iron ore). They will replace dirt and sandstone (but not grass or sand), so they can be found nearer to the surface than most ores. Intened to be used as a child distribution for large, rare strategic deposits that would otherwise be very difficult to find. Note that the frequency is multiplied by ground level to maintain a constant density, but not by ore frequency because it is assumed that the frequency of the parent distribution will already be scaled by that.

StandardGen.name: mknsOsmiumStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.
